title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in several places in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North-Western, and Southern provinces during the evening or night.

title: Sri Lanka gears up for its first ever animal census
byline: Sri Lanka will conduct its first-ever animal census, excluding elephants, officials said on Friday.

title: Police Constable arrested for soliciting Rs. 1,500 bribe
byline: A Police Constable attached to the Arachchikattuwa Police Station has been arrested on bribery charges after demanding and accepting a bribe of Rs. 1,500.

title: Two brothers hacked to death in Grandpass
byline: Two brothers, aged 23 and 24 years, have been found hacked to death in the Kelanitissagama area in Grandpass this morning (15), the police said.

title: Govt committed to breaking barriers for women in economy – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya highlighted that while women play a crucial role in Sri Lanka’s economic and social development, structural barriers still restrict their full participation in the economy.

title: Vacant seat in Parliament after Sali Naleem resigned as MP - Speaker
byline: The Speaker of Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has informed the House that Mohamed Sali Naleem, the National List Member of Parliament from the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC), has tendered his resignation letter to the Secretary General of Parliament today (15).

title: O/L exam: NIC confirmation letters available for collection today
byline: The Department of Registration of Persons has announced that candidates who have not yet received their National Identity Card (NIC) confirmation letters for the 2025 G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination will be able to obtain them today (15).

title: ‘Shan Putha’ and two others to be detained for 7 days
byline: Three suspects, including popular Sri Lankan rapper and singer Amila Kaushan Gunaratne, known by his stage name ‘Shan Putha’, have been ordered to be detained for 7 days for questioning following their arrest for the possession of a firearm.

title: Indian PM Modi to visit Sri Lanka in April, new agreements expected – Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath has announced that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka in the first few days of April 2025.

title: Excise duty increase on cigarettes approved after CoPF review
byline: Officials from the Ministry of Finance presented the steps taken to increase excise duty on cigarettes before the Committee on Public Finance (CoPF) under the Order under Section 3 of the Excise (Special Provisions) Act, No. 13 of 1989.

title: Sri Lanka to establish Action Task Force to address US tariff challenges - Foreign Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath informed Parliament today (15) that an action task force will be established to address the challenges posed by the evolving global tariff structures resulting from the policies of newly elected U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Gary Anandasangaree appointed Canada’s Minister of Justice
byline: Sri Lankan-born Gary Anandasangaree has been sworn in as the Minister of Justice and Attorney General of Canada, as well as the Minister of Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs, during a swearing-in ceremony at Rideau Hall in Ottawa on Friday.
